intro: Caralluma europaea var. barrueliana, commonly known as the Cape Hare’s foot, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It features a low-growing, sprawling stem with small, fleshy, spiny leaves that are adapted to arid environments. The plant produces bright yellow flowers during the warmer months, which are typically clustered at the ends of the stems. It is well-suited for rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental appeal. Its botanical characteristics make it an interesting subject for both horticultural study and ecological research.
